questions.question: If the monopolist depicted in Figure 1 is maximizing profits, the correct price/output combination will be:
questions.explanation: Profit maximization occurs where MR = MC (Q = 5). Price is found by moving up from Q = 5 to the demand curve, giving P = 10.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent identification of monopoly profit-maximizing price and output.
scoreMessages.70: Strong; review MR = MC rule and using demand curve to set price.
scoreMessages.50: Fair; revisit monopoly profit maximization steps.
scoreMessages.0: Needs review: how monopolists determine price and quantity.
